trans-unit.source: Network Configuration Details for Working with Express Route
trans-unit.target: Network Configuration Details for Working with Express Route

trans-unit.source: Network configuration details for running App Service Environments in a Virtual Networks connected to an ExpressRoute Circuit.
trans-unit.target: Network configuration details for running App Service Environments in a Virtual Networks connected to an ExpressRoute Circuit.

trans-unit.source: Customers can connect an <linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title> circuit to their virtual network infrastructure, thus extending their on-premises network to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Customers can connect an <linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title> circuit to their virtual network infrastructure, thus extending their on-premises network to Azure.

trans-unit.source: An App Service Environment can be created in a subnet of this <linkText>virtual network[virtualnetwork]</linkText><title></title> infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: An App Service Environment can be created in a subnet of this <linkText>virtual network[virtualnetwork]</linkText><title></title> infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Apps running on the App Service Environment can then establish secure connections to back-end resources accessible only over the ExpressRoute connection.
trans-unit.target: Apps running on the App Service Environment can then establish secure connections to back-end resources accessible only over the ExpressRoute connection.

trans-unit.source: There are network connectivity requirements for App Service Environments that may not be initially met in a virtual network connected to an ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: There are network connectivity requirements for App Service Environments that may not be initially met in a virtual network connected to an ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: App Service Environments require all of the following in order to function properly:
trans-unit.target: App Service Environments require all of the following in order to function properly:

trans-unit.source: Outbound network connectivity to both Azure Storage and Sql DB resources located in the same region as the App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: Outbound network connectivity to both Azure Storage and Sql DB resources located in the same region as the App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: This network path cannot travel through internal corporate proxies because doing so will likely change the effective NAT address of the outbound network traffic.
trans-unit.target: This network path cannot travel through internal corporate proxies because doing so will likely change the effective NAT address of the outbound network traffic.

trans-unit.source: Changing the NAT address of an App Service Environment's outbound network traffic directed at Azure Storage and Sql DB endpoints will cause connectivity failures.
trans-unit.target: Changing the NAT address of an App Service Environment's outbound network traffic directed at Azure Storage and Sql DB endpoints will cause connectivity failures.

trans-unit.source: The DNS configuration for the virtual network must be capable of resolving endpoints within the following Azure controlled domains: *.file.core.windows.net, *.blob.core.windows.net, *.database.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: The DNS configuration for the virtual network must be capable of resolving endpoints within the following Azure controlled domains: *.file.core.windows.net, *.blob.core.windows.net, *.database.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: DNS configuration for the virtual network must remain stable whenever App Service Environments are created, as well as during re-configurations and scaling changes to App Service Environments.
trans-unit.target: DNS configuration for the virtual network must remain stable whenever App Service Environments are created, as well as during re-configurations and scaling changes to App Service Environments.

trans-unit.source: Inbound network access to required ports for App Service Environments must be allowed as described in this <linkText>article[requiredports]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Inbound network access to required ports for App Service Environments must be allowed as described in this <linkText>article[requiredports]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The DNS requirement can be met by ensuring a valid DNS configuration for the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The DNS requirement can be met by ensuring a valid DNS configuration for the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: The inbound network access requirements can be met by configuring a <linkText>network security group[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title> on the App Service Environment's subnet to allow the required access as described in this <linkText>article[requiredports]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The inbound network access requirements can be met by configuring a <linkText>network security group[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title> on the App Service Environment's subnet to allow the required access as described in this <linkText>article[requiredports]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: By default, a newly created ExpressRoute circuit advertises a default route that allows outbound Internet connectivity.
trans-unit.target: By default, a newly created ExpressRoute circuit advertises a default route that allows outbound Internet connectivity.

trans-unit.source: With this configuration an App Service Environment will be able to connect to other Azure endpoints.
trans-unit.target: With this configuration an App Service Environment will be able to connect to other Azure endpoints.

trans-unit.source: However a common customer configuration is to define their own default route which forces outbound Internet traffic to instead flow on-premises through a customer's proxy/firewall infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: However a common customer configuration is to define their own default route which forces outbound Internet traffic to instead flow on-premises through a customer's proxy/firewall infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: This traffic flow invariably breaks App Service Environments because the outbound traffic is either blocked on-premises, or NAT'd to an unrecognizable set of addresses that no longer work with various Azure endpoints.
trans-unit.target: This traffic flow invariably breaks App Service Environments because the outbound traffic is either blocked on-premises, or NAT'd to an unrecognizable set of addresses that no longer work with various Azure endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The solution is to define one (or more) user defined routes (UDRs) on the subnet that contains the App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: The solution is to define one (or more) user defined routes (UDRs) on the subnet that contains the App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: A UDR defines subnet-specific routes that will be honored instead of the default route.
trans-unit.target: A UDR defines subnet-specific routes that will be honored instead of the default route.

trans-unit.source: Background information on user defined routes is available in this <linkText>overview[udroverview]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Background information on user defined routes is available in this <linkText>overview[udroverview]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Details on creating and configuring user defined routes is available in this <linkText>How To Guide[udrhowto]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Details on creating and configuring user defined routes is available in this <linkText>How To Guide[udrhowto]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Pre-requisites
trans-unit.target: Pre-requisites

trans-unit.source: Install the very latest Azure Powershell from the <linkText>Azure Downloads page[azuredownloads]</linkText><title></title> (dated June 2015 or later).
trans-unit.target: Install the very latest Azure Powershell from the <linkText>Azure Downloads page[azuredownloads]</linkText><title></title> (dated June 2015 or later).

trans-unit.source: Under "Command-line tools" there is an "Install" link under "Windows Powershell" that will install the latest Powershell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Under "Command-line tools" there is an "Install" link under "Windows Powershell" that will install the latest Powershell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that a unique subnet is created for exclusive use by an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that a unique subnet is created for exclusive use by an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that the UDRs applied to the subnet will only open outbound traffic for the App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that the UDRs applied to the subnet will only open outbound traffic for the App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: Important: do not deploy the App Service Environment until after the following configuration steps are followed.
trans-unit.target: Important: do not deploy the App Service Environment until after the following configuration steps are followed.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that outbound network connectivity is available before attempting to deploy an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that outbound network connectivity is available before attempting to deploy an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a named route table
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a named route table

trans-unit.source: The following snippet creates a route table called "DirectInternetRouteTable" in the West US Azure region:
trans-unit.target: The following snippet creates a route table called "DirectInternetRouteTable" in the West US Azure region:

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create one or more routes in the route table
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create one or more routes in the route table

trans-unit.source: You will need to add one or more routes to the route table in order to enable outbound Internet access.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add one or more routes to the route table in order to enable outbound Internet access.

trans-unit.source: The example below adds enough routes to cover all possible Azure addresses used in the West US region.
trans-unit.target: The example below adds enough routes to cover all possible Azure addresses used in the West US region.

trans-unit.source: For a comprehensive and updated list of CIDR ranges in use by Azure, you can download an Xml file containing all of the ranges from the <linkText>Microsoft Download Center[downloadcenteraddressranges]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a comprehensive and updated list of CIDR ranges in use by Azure, you can download an Xml file containing all of the ranges from the <linkText>Microsoft Download Center[downloadcenteraddressranges]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Note: at some point an abbreviated CIDR short-hand of 0.0.0.0/0 will be available for use in the AddressPrefix parameter.
trans-unit.target: Note: at some point an abbreviated CIDR short-hand of 0.0.0.0/0 will be available for use in the AddressPrefix parameter.

trans-unit.source: This short hand equates to "all Internet addresses".
trans-unit.target: This short hand equates to "all Internet addresses".

trans-unit.source: For now developers will need to instead use a broad set of CIDR ranges sufficient to cover all possible Azure address ranges used in the region where the App Service Environment has been deployed.
trans-unit.target: For now developers will need to instead use a broad set of CIDR ranges sufficient to cover all possible Azure address ranges used in the region where the App Service Environment has been deployed.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Associate the route table to the subnet containing the App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Associate the route table to the subnet containing the App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: The last configuration step is to associate the route table to the subnet where the App Service Environment will be deployed.
trans-unit.target: The last configuration step is to associate the route table to the subnet where the App Service Environment will be deployed.

trans-unit.source: The following command associates the "DirectInternetRouteTable" to the "ASESubnet" that will eventually contain an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: The following command associates the "DirectInternetRouteTable" to the "ASESubnet" that will eventually contain an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Final Steps
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Final Steps

trans-unit.source: Once the route table is bound to the subnet, it is recommended to first test and confirm the intended effect.
trans-unit.target: Once the route table is bound to the subnet, it is recommended to first test and confirm the intended effect.

trans-unit.source: For example, deploy a virtual machine into the subnet and confirm that:
trans-unit.target: For example, deploy a virtual machine into the subnet and confirm that:

trans-unit.source: Outbound traffic to Azure endpoints is not flowing down the ExpressRoute circuit.
trans-unit.target: Outbound traffic to Azure endpoints is not flowing down the ExpressRoute circuit.

trans-unit.source: DNS lookups for Azure endpoints are resolving properly.
trans-unit.target: DNS lookups for Azure endpoints are resolving properly.

trans-unit.source: Once the above steps are confirmed, you can proceed with creating an App Service Environment!
trans-unit.target: Once the above steps are confirmed, you can proceed with creating an App Service Environment!

trans-unit.source: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>Introduction to App Service Environment[introtoappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>Introduction to App Service Environment[introtoappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.
